title: Reagan Era Regulatory Capture Foundation and Powell Memorandum Implementation (1981-1989)
description: Research systematic implementation of Lewis Powell's corporate capture strategy during Reagan administration. Document deregulation campaigns, appointment of industry insiders to regulatory positions, and establishment of anti-government ideology as cover for corporate capture. Focus on how Reagan era created institutional framework for systematic kleptocratic capture used by subsequent administrations.
constitutional_issues: separation of powers erosion through industry insider appointments

key_sources.title: Reagan administration agency appointment records and industry backgrounds
key_sources.why: Documents systematic appointment of industry insiders to regulatory positions

key_sources.title: Heritage Foundation and American Enterprise Institute policy development records
key_sources.why: Shows coordinated ideological framework for regulatory capture

key_sources.title: Chamber of Commerce and Business Roundtable strategy documents
key_sources.why: Reveals systematic corporate strategy for government capture

key_sources.title: EPA, OSHA, and financial regulatory agency policy reversal documentation
key_sources.why: Documents systematic rollback of protective regulations

key_sources.title: OMB regulatory impact analysis manipulation records
key_sources.why: Shows systematic bias in cost-benefit analyses favoring industry

expected_outcomes: Documents foundational template for systematic regulatory capture
Reveals connection between Powell Memorandum strategy and Reagan implementation
Establishes baseline for understanding modern kleptocratic patterns
Shows how anti-government ideology serves as cover for corporate capture
Documents institutionalization of revolving door practices

connections.description: Reagan deregulation framework enables Bush Sr intelligence privatization
Reagan anti-regulatory framework enables Clinton financial deregulation

research_notes: Reagan era is foundational to modern kleptocracy - established institutional mechanisms and ideological cover that all subsequent administrations built upon. Focus on systematic patterns rather than individual scandals like Iran-Contra.
reprioritization_reason: Timeline coverage gap analysis - high value for unique content
